body_html: Try updating your cudnn, cudnn v5 is no longer supported by pytorch. In deciding whether to use cudnn.benchmark what's important is not how big the inputs are, but how often the size of the input changes (if at all). If your inputs are always the same size (or you have just a few possible input sizes) you can use cudnn.benchmark.

body: Try updating your cudnn, cudnn v5 is no longer supported by pytorch. In deciding whether to use cudnn.benchmark what's important is not how big the inputs are, but how often the size of the input changes (if at all). If your inputs are always the same size (or you have just a few possible input sizes) you can use cudnn.benchmark.
